product_title: Dr.Althea 345 Relief Cream | Daily Face Moisturizer for Soothing Recovery

overall_perception_summary.headline: The Transparent Prescription
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr.Althea strips away marketing fluff to position itself as a 'Pro Lab' instrument for skin recovery. By decoding its formula into numbers ('345') and adopting a stark Pharma-Code aesthetic, it successfully democratizes clinical precision for the mass market. It plays the role of the Accessible Dermatologist—offering high-specificity post-acne care without the velvet rope of a prescription.

foundation.title: The Clinical Democratizer
foundation.description: The brand grounds its authority in a 'Pro Lab' identity, balancing potent repair ingredients with a Safety First value system. It targets specific pathology (blemishes, post-acne) but distributes it with democratic access (Rank #7, $22). The payoff is professional-grade restoration that feels like a daily essential rather than a luxury splurge.

identity.title: The Analytic Sage
identity.description: The personality is distant and expert, operating from The Reliable Expert territory. Dominant Sage energy (60%) drives a narrative of truth and structure, reinforced by a sterile Pharma-Code visual identity. The tone is The Clinical Authority—dry, factual, and devoid of humor.

communication.title: Evidence-Based Education
communication.description: Messaging hooks the user with components ('PDRN', 'Niacinamide') and persuades via rational data ('177% boost'). The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough story, emphasizing mechanism over romance. It focuses on Science Education, using the PDP to teach the '345' formula structure rather than to inspire desire.

benefits.title: Restorative Safety
benefits.description: Functionally, it is a Restoration engine, designed to fix barrier damage and soothe irritation. Emotionally, it provides Relief and Safety from skin anxiety. Socially, it serves as The Safe Choice—a pragmatic, highly-validated purchase that signals intelligence and immunity to hype.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The brand name 'Dr.Althea' and 'Pro Lab' branding anchor authority in the clinic, supported by 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' seals (Origin: 2/5 Derm-Validated). The mission is explicitly corrective—targeting 'Blemish Care', 'Post-acne', and 'Recovery' rather than general enhancement (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). It exists to fix a problem.
marker_1.evidence: 3 BLEMISH RELIEF INGREDIENTS... Soothing Recovery... Post-acne skincare routine... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (1/5) match the grid for Territory 1 (The Healer). The content consistently emphasizes clinical validation and corrective action.

marker_2.reasoning: While the packaging looks premium/medical, the market position is radically democratic. Being the #7 Face Moisturizer with 11k+ reviews and a $22 price point indicates mass accessibility (Access: 5/5 Democratic). The scope is focused on optimizing skin health ('achieving clearer and more radiant skin') rather than a global crusade (Scope: 2/5 Optimization).
marker_2.evidence: #7 in Face Moisturizers... 11,804 global ratings... $22.95... Daily Face Moisturizer

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (5/5) match Territory 1. High accessibility combined with skin-focused scope defines The Democratizer.

marker_3.reasoning: Despite listing potent ingredients, the overriding priority is safety and tolerance ('Relief', 'Soothing', 'Non-comedogenic', 'Hypoallergenic'). The '345' concept structurally emphasizes 5 soothing ingredients over 3 blemish ones (Performance: 2/5 Gentle). Transparency is high, with full lists and clinical seals visible (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First).
marker_3.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Care for sensitive skin... Clinically tested as non-comedogenic... free from artificial coloring

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (2/5) maps to Territory 1 (Safety First). The content balances clinical data with a heavy emphasis on safety and relief.

marker_4.reasoning: The visual code is stark white, black typography, and grid layouts, deliberately stripping away emotion to look like a prescription (Aesthetic: 1/5 Sterile). The framing as a 'Daily Face Moisturizer' at a mid-range price point positions it as a high-functioning essential rather than a luxury object (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential).
marker_4.evidence: Daily Face Moisturizer... Pro Lab... White squeeze tube... Typographic-heavy packaging

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5) + Slider B (2/5) matches Territory 1. The clinical aesthetic combined with utility positioning creates The Medical Authority.

marker_5.reasoning: The brand speaks with the cool detachment of a clinician. There are no exclamation marks or slang. It uses structured lists ('3 Blemish...', '4 Nourishing...') and medical terms ('PDRN', 'Madecassoside') to establish high competence (Authority: 4/5). It is helpful but not 'warm' (Warmth: 2/5).
marker_5.evidence: 3 BLEMISH RELIEF INGREDIENTS... 4 NOURISHING INGREDIENTS... 5 SOOTHING INGREDIENTS... Clinically tested

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (4/5) matches Territory 3 (The Reliable Expert). High authority and low-mid warmth define this territory.

marker_6.reasoning: The dominant energy is The Sage (60%), driven by the intellectual '345' framework that explains the formula's logic. This is supported by The Caregiver (25%) via the 'Relief' and 'Safety' promises. A dash of The Hero (15%) appears in the 'Recovery' and 'Blemish Care' efficacy claims. The overall mix creates The Philosopher territory: principled, clear, and disciplined.
marker_6.evidence: 3 BLEMISH RELIEF... 4 NOURISHING... 5 SOOTHING... Pro Lab... Relief Cream... Soothing Recovery

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Archetype mix uses percentage dominance, not grid lookup.

marker_7.reasoning: The voice is purely informational. It communicates in lists and functional claims without any attempt at entertainment or emotion. Humor is non-existent (1/5), and enthusiasm is restrained to clinical facts (2/5). This maps perfectly to Territory 1.
marker_7.evidence: This cream contains a potent blend... Clinically tested as non-comedogenic... The multi-layered cream structure

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Low Humor (1) + Low Enthusiasm (2) + Professional Formality (3) meets the hard rule for Territory 1 (Clinical Authority).

marker_8.reasoning: The visual strategy is 'Pro Lab' sterility. The dominant color is white (#FFFFFF) with black text. Images are structured grids or clean packshots. There is no chaos, no sensory warmth—just data visualization and packaging that looks like a medical chart (Temp: 1/5, Entropy: 2/5).
marker_8.evidence: Stark black-on-white typography... clinical, pharmaceutical... Pro Lab... Grid layout
marker_8.look_and_feel: A stark, information-dense aesthetic that mimics pharmaceutical packaging with high-contrast typography and sterile white space.
marker_8.distinctive_asset_1: Numerical identifier '345' in large serif font
marker_8.distinctive_asset_3: Dense ingredient list on front packaging
marker_8.distinctive_asset_5: Sterile white tube with black typography
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical monochrome (Black/White) with accent touches of pale medicinal green.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5) + Slider B (2/5) maps directly to Territory 1 (Pharma-Code).

marker_9.reasoning: The hook is the component list: '345' stands for the ingredients themselves (Niacinamide, PDRN, Tea Tree). The persuasion is rational cause-and-effect: 'This cream contains X... to help reduce Y.' It sells the noun (ingredients) via logic.
marker_9.evidence: 3 BLEMISH RELIEF INGREDIENTS... PDRN & Niacinamide... 177% immediate boost in skin hydration

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (2/5) matches Territory 1 (The Chemist). Ingredient focus + rational logic defines this territory.

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is 'Dr.Althea' (a construct of authority) and the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences.' The setting is the 'Pro Lab'—illustrated by glassware graphics and molecular diagrams. It is a story of institutional science, not personal struggle or nature.
marker_10.evidence: Dr.Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Pro Lab... Scientific glassware imagery

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5) + Slider B (1/5) matches Territory 1 (The Lab Breakthrough).

marker_11.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Stat ('95% saw reduction in acne')
marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes from 'The Board'—specifically the Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences. Proof is presented as stats ('177% boost') and clinical test completions ('Skin Irritation Tested'). The authority is institutional and numerical.
marker_11.evidence: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... 177% immediate boost... Clinical trial completed

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5) + Slider B (2/5) maps to Territory 1 (Derm-Validation).

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand attempts to own the '345' framework as a signature complex concept (Ownership: 3/5). However, the market scope is highly specific: it is a 'Relief Cream' for 'Post-acne' and 'Blemish Care.' It doesn't sell itself as a general moisturizer, but as a specialist tool for a specific condition (Scope: 4/5).
marker_12.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Post-acne skincare routine... Blemish Care... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (3/5) + Slider B (4/5) maps to Territory 4 (The Specialist). The proprietary concept + niche problem focus defines this.

marker_13.reasoning: The PDP allocates maximum space to explaining the formula structure ('345') and providing clinical validation (charts, seals, '177%'). It is an educational thesis on why this specific combination of ingredients works for acne repair.
marker_13.evidence: Infographic... Ingredient Focus... Clinical trial completed... 177% immediate boost

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (1/5) matches Territory 1 (Science Education).

marker_14.reasoning: The product's core action is 'Recovery' and 'Relief'—healing the damage of acne (Action: 4/5). The outcome is balanced between health and sensory relief ('Soothing', 'Calming'), aiming to return skin to a healthy baseline rather than aesthetic perfection (Outcome: 2/5).
marker_14.evidence: Soothing Recovery... Blemish Care... Restore dull skin... Calming ingredients

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (4/5) + Slider B (2/5) maps to Territory 1 (Restoration).

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.reasoning: The product targets the anxiety of 'acne-prone' and 'sensitive' skin. The emotional promise is the cessation of worry ('Relief', 'Soothing', 'Safe'). It validates the user's need for safety and a return to normalcy (Comfort).
marker_15.evidence: Relief Cream... Care for sensitive skin... Safe and gentle... Soothe your skin effectively

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (1/5) + Slider B (2/5) matches Territory 1 (Relief/Safety).

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Smart Choice (because it makes sense)
marker_16.reasoning: Buying this product signals that you are a rational consumer who looks at the ingredients ('345') and the data ('Pro Lab'). While it is trending (K-Beauty), the purchase motivation is framed as 'Smart'—it works, it's safe, and it's $22. It is not a luxury totem.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (2/5) matches Territory 1 (The Pragmatist). Logic-driven purchase of a popular item.

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Acceptance (I want to be accepted by the group)
marker_17.reasoning: With 11,000+ reviews and a #7 rank, this is the herd's choice for post-acne care. It offers the safety of numbers. You aren't taking a risk; you are joining the majority who have already validated it.
marker_17.evidence: 11,804 global ratings... Best Sellers Rank: #7 in Face Moisturizers... 4.6 out of 5 stars

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (2/5) + Slider B (1/5) matches Territory 1 (The Safe Choice).
